headline: UK gilt selloff triggers pension cash calls in first big test since 2022 crisis
summary: Some British pension funds are being told by asset managers to come up with more cash to support their hedging positions after a recent jump in borrowing costs, but pensions advisers told Reuters this week the market was behaving in an orderly way.  XPS and Gallagher said some funds had been instructed to post more cash to maintain derivatives positions they hold through so-called Liability Driven Investment (LDI) strategies.  BlackRock, a major LDI provider, said in a note to clients on Friday that although higher borrowing costs will have reduced pension schemes' collateral resilience, funds were better prepared than previously to withstand volatility.

BlackRock, a major LDI provider, said in a note to clients on Friday that although higher borrowing costs will have reduced pension schemes' collateral resilience, funds were better prepared than previously to withstand volatility.
